author: qizhou
content: Suppose we can prove that the data is replicated to 10x or more storage devices, could we safely assume that the proof of retrievability is solved?  This requires some assumption on honesty of the nodes that host the 10x storage devices that are willing to provide data availability.

author: qizhou
content: Take a look at this, and have a few questions: 1. this seems to prove a validator has own the data D, but it seems that the validator can still do withholding by rejecting all downloads of D from peers?  2.  If a large staker (e.g., lido) joins the network, it may potentially keep only one copy of the data D while serving all validators of the staker of the shards?  This may hurt the actual replication factors of D.
